channel.title: DATA606: Algorithms for Data Science
channel.description: Recent content on DATA606: Algorithms for Data Science

item.title: Project 1: Similar document searching via MinHash and Locality Sensitive Hashing
item.description: In this first project we will implement the system described in the lecture notes for similar document searching. This project is inspired by http://mccormickml.com/2015/06/12/minhash-tutorial-with-python-code/ (Note: you can look at code there for inspiration but implement your own).

item.title: CMSC Resources
item.description: Install Biopython Download and install Python 2.7 Download and install Anaconda Use the following commad to install biopython: conda install -c anaconda biopython=1.68

item.title: CMSC644: Algorithms for Data Science - Calendar
Resources
item.description: Setting up your learning system We will use Python to experiment with algorithms and datasets in the course. Follow these instructions to set it up Download and install Python 3: https://www.python.org/downloads/ Download and install the Anaconda scientific python distribution: https://www.continuum.io/downloads/ You can use anaconda to manage your python environment from the terminal or using the Anaconda Navigator graphical interface. For the latter, here is a quick guide: https://docs.

item.title: Logistics
item.description: This page and the Course Calendar constitute the official syllabus for this class. Course Information Algorithms for Data Science DATA 606 Spring 2020 Lecture Meeting Times Tuesdays 6:00pm-9:30pm CSI 3118 Instructor: Héctor Corrada Bravo Center for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Department of Computer Science hcorrada@umiacs.umd.edu Office: IRB 3226 Office Hours: before and after class or by appointment Communication: All communication will done through ELMS at https://umd.

item.title: DATA 606: Algorithms for Data Science

Check the logistics page for more information, including the official syllabus. Grades and assignments posted in ELMS. Discussion and questions in ELMS.
